properties.name: cds.environment
properties.doc: Properties for environments, like local development or Cloud Foundry.

properties.name: cds.environment.local
properties.doc: Properties for the local environment.

properties.name: cds.environment.local.defaultEnvPath
properties.doc:
Specification of the default environment JSON file. If this property starts with "classpath:", it is read
as classloader resource. Otherwise it is interpreted as file-system path.
The file content follows the structure of Cloud Foundry's VCAP_SERVICES and VCAP_APPLICATION environment variables.
If this property specifies a folder, the filename `default-env.json` is appended to it.

properties.name: cds.dataSource
properties.doc: Properties for the primary data source, used by the default persistence service.

properties.name: cds.dataSource.embedded
properties.doc: Determines, if the data source is considered embedded (in-memory).

properties.name: cds.dataSource.binding
properties.doc: The name of the primary service binding, used by the default persistence service.

properties.name: cds.dataSource.csv
properties.doc: Properties for CSV initialization.

properties.name: cds.dataSource.csv.initializationMode
properties.doc:
Determines in which scenarios the default persistence service is initialized with CSV data.
By default, CSV initialization only happens, if the data source is embedded (in-memory).
Possible values are: `embedded`, `never`, `always`.

properties.name: cds.dataSource.csv.fileSuffix
properties.doc: The file suffix of CSV files.

properties.name: cds.dataSource.csv.paths
properties.doc:
The file-system paths to search for CSV files in.
Using `/**` at the end of the path triggers a recursive search.

properties.name: cds.dataSource.csv.singleChangeset
properties.doc: Enables import of all CSV files in a single changeset. By default, each CSV file is imported in a separate changeset.

properties.name: cds.dataSource.autoConfig
properties.doc: Properties to control the `DataSource` auto-configuration from service bindings.

properties.name: cds.dataSource.autoConfig.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.model
properties.doc: Properties for the CDS model.

properties.name: cds.model.csnPath
properties.doc: The resource path to the `csn.json` file.

properties.name: cds.model.includeUiAnnotations
properties.doc: Determines, if UI annotations are included in the model.

properties.name: cds.model.provider
properties.doc: The model provider configuration.

properties.name: cds.model.provider.url
properties.doc: The URL of the Model Provider.

properties.name: cds.model.provider.cache
properties.doc: Properties for the CDS model and EDMX metadata caches.

properties.name: cds.model.provider.cache.maxSize
properties.doc: The number of entries in the CDS model and EDMX metadata caches.

properties.name: cds.model.provider.cache.expirationTime
properties.doc: The lifetime of an entry in seconds after the entry's creation, the most recent replacement of its value, or its last access.

properties.name: cds.model.provider.cache.refreshTime
properties.doc: The time in seconds after which a cached entry is refreshed.

properties.name: cds.security
properties.doc: Properties for security configurations of services and endpoints.

properties.name: cds.security.logPotentiallySensitive
properties.doc: Determines, if potentially sensitive data, for example values in CQN queries, might be logged.

properties.name: cds.security.authentication
properties.doc: Properties for authentication in general.

properties.name: cds.security.authentication.mode
properties.doc:
Determines the mode that is used when authenticating endpoints of protocol-adapters. Possible values are:
- never: No endpoint requires authentication
- model-relaxed: Authentication is derived from @requires/@restrict, defaults to public endpoints.
- model-strict: Authentication is derived from @requires/@restrict, defaults to authenticated endpoints.
- always: All endpoints require authentication

properties.name: cds.security.authentication.authenticateMetadataEndpoints
properties.doc: Determines, if OData $metadata endpoints enforce authentication.

properties.name: cds.security.authentication.authenticateUnknownEndpoints
properties.doc: Determines, if security configurations enforce authentication for endpoints not managed by protocol-adapters.

properties.name: cds.security.authentication.normalizeProviderTenant
properties.doc: Determines, if the provider tenant is normalized to `null`.

properties.name: cds.security.authorization
properties.doc: Properties for authorization.

properties.name: cds.security.authorization.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.security.authorization.draftProtection
properties.doc:
Properties to control the protection of drafts.
If a draft is protected, it is only accessible by its creator.

properties.name: cds.security.authorization.draftProtection.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.security.identity
properties.doc: Properties for authentication based on Identity Service (IAS).

properties.name: cds.security.identity.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.security.identity.authConfig
properties.doc: Properties for the Identity Spring security auto-configuration.

properties.name: cds.security.identity.authConfig.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.security.xsuaa
properties.doc: Properties for authentication based on XSUAA.

properties.name: cds.security.xsuaa.binding
properties.doc: The name of the XSUAA service binding, used for the XSUAA security auto-configuration.

properties.name: cds.security.xsuaa.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.security.xsuaa.authConfig
properties.doc: Properties for the XSUAA Spring security auto-configuration.

properties.name: cds.security.xsuaa.authConfig.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.security.mock
properties.doc: Properties for authentication based on mock-users.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users
properties.doc:
The mock-users, used for basic authentication in local development and test scenarios.
The key can be chosen arbitrarily and is used as the user name, if the `name` property is not explicitly defined.
In addition it can be leveraged to split configuration across multiple profiles.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.id
properties.doc: The ID of the mock-user.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.name
properties.doc:
The (mandatory) name of the mock-user.
It's used to perform the basic authentication.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.password
properties.doc:
The (optional) password of the mock-user.
It's used to perform the basic authentication.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.tenant
properties.doc: The tenant of the mock-user.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.systemUser
properties.doc: Determines, if this mock-user is treated as a system user.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.privileged
properties.doc: Determines, if this mock-user is treated as the privileged user.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.internalUser
properties.doc: Determines, if this mock-user is treated as the internal user.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.roles
properties.doc: The list of roles, that are assigned to this mock-user.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.features
properties.doc: The list of enabled feature toggles for this user. If set, it overrules features of the tenant (if provided).

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.attributes
properties.doc:
A map of user attributes, that are assigned to the mock-user.
The name of the attribute needs to be given as the key.
The attribute values are provided as a list.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.unrestricted
properties.doc:
A list of attribute names, for which the mock-user has no restrictions.
This is treated as if the mock-user effectively had all possible values of this attribute assigned.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.users.<key>.additional
properties.doc:
A map of additional properties of the mock-user.
It can be used to mock authentication specific properties (e.g. email address).
The name of the additional attribute needs to be given as the key.
The value of the attribute can be provided as an arbitrary object.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.defaultUsers
properties.doc: Enables a list of default mock-users.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.defaultUsers.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.tenants
properties.doc:
The tenants in local development and test scenarios.
The key can be chosen arbitrarily and is used as the tenant name, if the `name` property is not explicitly defined.
In addition it can be leveraged to split configuration across multiple profiles.

properties.name: cds.security.mock.tenants.<key>.name
properties.doc: The (mandatory) name of the tenant

properties.name: cds.security.mock.tenants.<key>.features
properties.doc: The list of enabled feature toggles for this tenant.

properties.name: cds.indexPage
properties.doc: Properties for the index page.

properties.name: cds.indexPage.path
properties.doc: The base-path of the adapter endpoint.

properties.name: cds.indexPage.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.odataV4
properties.doc: Properties for the OData V4 protocol adapter.

properties.name: cds.odataV4.contextAbsoluteUrl
properties.doc: Determines, if URLs in the @odata.context response annotation are absolute.

properties.name: cds.odataV4.edmxPath
properties.doc: The JAR resource path to search for OData V4 EDMX files.

properties.name: cds.odataV4.endpoint
properties.doc: Properties of the OData V4 protocol adapter endpoint.

properties.name: cds.odataV4.endpoint.path
properties.doc: The base-path of the adapter endpoint.

properties.name: cds.odataV4.endpoint.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.odataV4.batch
properties.doc: Properties for OData batch requests.

properties.name: cds.odataV4.batch.maxRequests
properties.doc: Defines the maximum number of requests within OData batch requests. By default, no limit applies.

properties.name: cds.odataV2
properties.doc: Properties for the OData V2 protocol adapter.

properties.name: cds.odataV2.edmxPath
properties.doc: The JAR resource path to search for OData V2 EDMX files.

properties.name: cds.odataV2.caseSensitiveFilter
properties.doc:
Determines whether OData functions 'substringof', 'startswith' and 'endswith' are
case-sensitive.

properties.name: cds.odataV2.endpoint
properties.doc: Properties of the OData V2 protocol adapter endpoint.

properties.name: cds.odataV2.endpoint.path
properties.doc: The base-path of the adapter endpoint.

properties.name: cds.odataV2.endpoint.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.odataV2.batch
properties.doc: Properties for OData batch requests.

properties.name: cds.odataV2.batch.maxRequests
properties.doc: Defines the maximum number of requests within OData batch requests. By default, no limit applies.

properties.name: cds.hcql
properties.doc: Properties for the HCQL protocol adapter.

properties.name: cds.hcql.endpoint
properties.doc: Properties of the HCQL protocol adapter endpoint.

properties.name: cds.hcql.endpoint.path
properties.doc: The base-path of the adapter endpoint.

properties.name: cds.hcql.endpoint.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.messaging
properties.doc: Properties for messaging services.

properties.name: cds.messaging.routes
properties.doc:
The list of routes for the composite messaging service.
The first route that matches is used. Therefore the order of these routes has significance.

properties.name: cds.messaging.routes.<index>.service
properties.doc: The target service of the route.

properties.name: cds.messaging.routes.<index>.events
properties.doc: The list of events/topics, which are propagated to/from the target service.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services
properties.doc:
Properties for messaging services.
The key can be chosen arbitrarily and is used as the messaging service name, if the `name` property is not explicitly defined.
In addition it can be leveraged to split configuration across multiple profiles.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.name
properties.doc: The name of the messaging service.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.kind
properties.doc:
The kind of the messaging service.
It usually reflects the corresponding service binding type.
Possible values are: `local-messaging`, `file-based-messaging`,
`enterprise-messaging`, `message-queuing`, `redis-pubsub`,
`kafka-channel-messaging`.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.binding
properties.doc:
The name of the service binding used for this messaging service.
In case of file-based-messaging this specifies the file-system path to the exchange file.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.subscribePrefix
properties.doc: The string used to prefix topics when subscribing to events.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.publishPrefix
properties.doc: The string used to prefix topics when publishing events.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.format
properties.doc:
The message format to be assumed on subscriptions and applied when publishing.
Possible values are: `cloudevents`

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.connection
properties.doc: Properties for the JMS client connection.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.connection.dedicated
properties.doc:
Determines, if this messaging service uses its own dedicated JMS client connection.
By default, JMS client connections to the same messaging broker are shared.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.connection.properties
properties.doc:
Properties passed to the JMS client connection.
The possible keys and values depend on the messaging service implementation.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.queue
properties.doc: Properties of the queue that is created for the messaging service.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.queue.name
properties.doc:
The name of the queue.
The queue may already exist with some custom configuration. In that case the queue is not recreated.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.queue.config
properties.doc:
Properties passed to the messaging broker when creating the queue.
The possible keys and values depend on the messaging service implementation.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.queue.subscriptions
properties.doc:
A list of additional topics, that are subscribed on the queue.
By default event handler registrations should be used to trigger subscriptions.
This property is intended for purposes when subscriptions can not be inferred from event handler registrations.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.queue.forceListening
properties.doc: Specifies whether a queue listener should be connected even if no subscription is available.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.outbox
properties.doc: Properties to control, if and how the Outbox should be used for this messaging service.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.outbox.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.outbox.persistent
properties.doc: Controls usage of the persistent Outbox if present.

properties.name: cds.messaging.services.<key>.outbox.persistent.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy
properties.doc: Properties for multitenancy and extensibility.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.componentScan
properties.doc: Package to be included in the component scan of the Subscribe, Deploy and Unsubscribe main methods.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.endpoint
properties.doc: Properties of the subscription HTTP endpoints.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.endpoint.path
properties.doc: The base-path of the adapter endpoint.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.endpoint.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.dataSource
properties.doc: Properties for the multitenant aware datasource.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.dataSource.pool
properties.doc:
Pool to use for the multitenant-aware datasource.
Possible values are: `hikari`, `tomcat`, `atomikos`.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.dataSource.combinePools
properties.doc:
Properties to control how the connection pools are maintained.
This allows to configure, that the connection pools for tenants contained in the same database are combined. Instead of having a dedicated connection pool for each tenant schema.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.dataSource.combinePools.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.serviceManager
properties.doc: Properties for the instance-manager / service-manager client.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.serviceManager.timeout
properties.doc: The timeout for requests in seconds.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.serviceManager.cacheRefreshInterval
properties.doc: The cache refresh interval (as Duration).

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.security
properties.doc: Properties for authorization.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.security.subscriptionScope
properties.doc: The scope by which the subscription endpoints are authorized.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.sidecar
properties.doc: Properties for the MTX sidecar client.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.sidecar.url
properties.doc:
The URL of the MTX sidecar.
Setting this property, in combination with a present service-manager service binding, activates the MTX features.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.sidecar.pollingTimeout
properties.doc: Specifies the maximum waiting time for the operation to finish.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.sidecar.cache
properties.doc: Properties for the sidecar CDS model and EDMX metadata caches.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.sidecar.cache.maxSize
properties.doc: The number of entries in the CDS model and EDMX metadata caches.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.sidecar.cache.expirationTime
properties.doc: The lifetime of an entry in seconds after the entry's creation, the most recent replacement of its value, or its last access.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.sidecar.cache.refreshTime
properties.doc: The time in seconds after which a cached entry is refreshed.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.appUi
properties.doc: Properties for the URL to the application's UI endpoints.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.appUi.url
properties.doc: The URL to the application's UI, used for the 'Go to Application' link.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.appUi.tenantSeparator
properties.doc:
The separator for the tenant in the URL.
Possible values are: `.`, `-`.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.healthCheck
properties.doc: Properties for health check of the multitenant-aware datasource.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.healthCheck.healthCheckStatement
properties.doc: The statement that is used when executing a health check of the multitenant-aware datasource.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.healthCheck.interval
properties.doc: The time a health check result is cached and no further health checks are performed.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.healthCheck.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.liquibase
properties.doc: Properties for DB lifecycle management via Liquibase.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.liquibase.changeLog
properties.doc: The location of the master Liquibase file.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.liquibase.contexts
properties.doc: Optional: Comma separated list of active contexts.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.provisioning
properties.doc: Properties for the ProvisioningService from @sap/cds-mtxs.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.provisioning.pollingTimeout
properties.doc: Specifies the maximum waiting time for the provisioning operation to finish.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.mtxs
properties.doc: Indicates usage of @sap/cds-mtxs module (MTX streamlined).

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.mtxs.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.mock
properties.doc: Properties for the SQLite-based MTX mock for local development and testing.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.mock.sqliteDirectory
properties.doc: Path to the directory to start looking for SQLite database files.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.mock.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.compatibility
properties.doc: Properties for the MtSubscriptionService API compatibility mode.

properties.name: cds.multiTenancy.compatibility.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.persistence
properties.doc: Properties for persistence services.

properties.name: cds.persistence.services
properties.doc:
Properties for persistence services.
The key can be chosen arbitrarily and is used as the persistence service name, if the `name` property is not explicitly defined.
In addition it can be leveraged to split configuration across multiple profiles.

properties.name: cds.persistence.services.<key>.name
properties.doc: The name of the persistence service.

properties.name: cds.persistence.services.<key>.binding
properties.doc: The name of the service binding used for this persistence service. If not set, the name is used.

properties.name: cds.persistence.services.<key>.dataSource
properties.doc: The name of the existing data source. If not set, the auto-configured data source of the binding is used.

properties.name: cds.persistence.services.<key>.transactionManager
properties.doc: The name of the existing transaction manager. If not set, the transaction manager is automatically created.

properties.name: cds.persistence.services.<key>.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.application
properties.doc: Properties for application services.

properties.name: cds.application.services
properties.doc:
Properties for application services.
The key can be chosen arbitrarily and is used as the application service name, if the `name` property is not explicitly defined.
In addition it can be leveraged to split configuration across multiple profiles.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.name
properties.doc: The name of the application service.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.model
properties.doc:
The qualified name of the CDS service, which is the model definition of this application service.
It defaults to the name of the application service itself.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.serve
properties.doc: Properties to configure how this service is served by protocol adapters.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.serve.ignore
properties.doc: Determines, if the service is ignored by protocol adapters.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.serve.path
properties.doc:
The path this service should be served at by protocol adapters.
The path is appended to the protocol adapter's base path.
If a service is served by multiple protocol adapters, each adapter serves the service under this path.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.serve.protocols
properties.doc:
The list of protocols adapters this service should be served by.
By default the service is served by all available protocol adapters.
Possible values are: `odata-v4`, `odata-v2`.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.serve.endpoints
properties.doc:
Properties to control more fine-grained under which endpoints this service is served.
These properties override the more general properties `paths` and `protocols`.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.serve.endpoints.<index>.path
properties.doc:
The path, this endpoint should be served at by the protocol adapter.
The path is appended to the protocol adapter's base path.

properties.name: cds.application.services.<key>.serve.endpoints.<index>.protocol
properties.doc:
The protocol adapter that serves this endpoint.
Possible values are: `odata-v4`, `odata-v2`.

properties.name: cds.remote
properties.doc: Properties for remote services.

properties.name: cds.remote.services
properties.doc:
Properties for remote services.
The key can be chosen arbitrarily and is mainly intended to be able to split configuration across multiple profiles.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.name
properties.doc: The name of the remote service.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.model
properties.doc:
The qualified name of the CDS service, which is the model definition of this remote service.
It defaults to the name of the remote service itself.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination
properties.doc: Properties to configure a remote destination for this remote service.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.type
properties.doc:
The protocol type of the destination.
Possible values are: `odata-v4`, `odata-v2` and `hcql`.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.name
properties.doc: The name of the destination in the destination service or SAP Cloud SDK destination accessor.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.suffix
properties.doc: A suffix for this destination, that is appended to the destination's URL.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.service
properties.doc:
The name of the service, that is appended to the destination's URL (after the suffix).
It defaults to the qualified name of the model definition.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.properties
properties.doc:
A map of generic destination properties supported by SAP Cloud SDK.
These properties are used to dynamically build a destination.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.headers
properties.doc: A map of headers and their values, to be added to every outgoing request.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.queries
properties.doc: A map of query parameters and their values, to be added to every outgoing request.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.retrievalStrategy
properties.doc:
The retrieval strategy used, when loading destinations from SAP BTP Destination Service.
See https://sap.github.io/cloud-sdk/docs/java/features/connectivity/sdk-connectivity-destination-service#retrieval-strategy-options for possible values.

properties.name: cds.remote.services.<key>.destination.tokenExchangeStrategy
properties.doc:
The token exchange strategy used, when loading destinations from SAP BTP Destination Service.
See https://sap.github.io/cloud-sdk/docs/java/features/connectivity/sdk-connectivity-destination-service#token-exchange-options for possible values.

properties.name: cds.locales
properties.doc: Properties for locale configurations.

properties.name: cds.locales.normalization
properties.doc: Properties to configure how locales should be normalized.

properties.name: cds.locales.normalization.defaults
properties.doc: Determines, if the non-normalization include list, as described in the documentation, is applied.

properties.name: cds.locales.normalization.includeList
properties.doc: The list of additional locales to add to the include list of non-normalized locales.

properties.name: cds.errors
properties.doc: Properties for error handling.

properties.name: cds.errors.extended
properties.doc: Determines, if error messages are automatically extended with additional debug information (only for development).

properties.name: cds.errors.combined
properties.doc: Determines, if validation error messages are collected and exceptions are thrown at the end of the Before event handler phase.

properties.name: cds.errors.stackMessages
properties.doc:
Properties to configure how error messages from the framework are treated.
If turned off, only framework error messages, that are explicitly localized are returned.
Other errors are mapped to their plain HTTP error code representation.

properties.name: cds.errors.stackMessages.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.drafts
properties.doc: Properties for draft-enabled entities.

properties.name: cds.drafts.cancellationTimeout
properties.doc: The maximum amount of time, since the last change, an entity instance is locked by the user who is editing its draft version.

properties.name: cds.drafts.deletionTimeout
properties.doc: The maximum amount of time a draft is kept, before it is garbage collected.

properties.name: cds.drafts.gc
properties.doc: Properties to configure the automatic draft garbage collection.

properties.name: cds.drafts.gc.interval
properties.doc: The interval, in which the automatic draft garbage collection is triggered.

properties.name: cds.drafts.gc.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.query
properties.doc: Properties for augmentation of CQN queries.

properties.name: cds.query.limit
properties.doc: Properties for server-driven paging.

properties.name: cds.query.limit.default
properties.doc:
The default page size for server-driven paging.
Setting this property to 0 or -1 disables the default page size.

properties.name: cds.query.limit.max
properties.doc:
The maximum page size for server-driven paging.
Setting this property to 0 or -1 disables the maximum page size.

properties.name: cds.query.limit.reliablePaging
properties.doc: Properties for reliable server-driven paging, based on last row of ordered result.

properties.name: cds.query.limit.reliablePaging.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.query.implicitSorting
properties.doc: Properties for the implicit-sorting feature.

properties.name: cds.query.implicitSorting.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.sql
properties.doc: Properties for SQL generation.

properties.name: cds.sql.supportedLocales
properties.doc:
A comma-separated list of locales that are considered during query execution
of localized requests. This configuration only has effect on other databases
than SAP HANA. It only applies, when the query processing falls back to
localized views.

properties.name: cds.sql.maxBatchSize
properties.doc: The JDBC batch size used for batch and bulk operations.

properties.name: cds.sql.hana
properties.doc: Configuration properties for an SQL generation on SAP HANA.

properties.name: cds.sql.hana.ignoreLocale
properties.doc: If set to `true`, this property completely disables locale specific handling on SAP HANA.

properties.name: cds.auditLog
properties.doc: Properties for AuditLog configuration.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.v2
properties.doc: Configuration of the AuditLog V2 feature.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.v2.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.personalData
properties.doc: Configuration of the Personal Data handler.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.personalData.throwOnMissingDataSubject
properties.doc: If set to {@code true} and the data subject is missing, a `ServiceException` is thrown.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.personalData.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.outbox
properties.doc: Properties to configure AuditLog usage of Outbox.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.outbox.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.outbox.persistent
properties.doc: Controls usage of the persistent Outbox if present.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.outbox.persistent.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.connectionPool
properties.doc: Properties to configure the HTTP connection pool for AuditLog usage.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.connectionPool.maxConnections
properties.doc: The max amount of connections in the pool.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.connectionPool.maxConnectionsPerRoute
properties.doc: The max amount of connections from the pool per route

properties.name: cds.auditLog.connectionPool.timeout
properties.doc: The threshold for connect timeout, socket timeout and connection request timeout.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.connectionPool.combinePools
properties.doc:
Properties to control how the http connection pools are maintained.
This allows to configure, whether all tenants will share a common http connection pool instead of having a dedicated http connection pool for each tenant.

properties.name: cds.auditLog.connectionPool.combinePools.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.outbox
properties.doc: Properties for Outbox configuration.

properties.name: cds.outbox.inMemory
properties.doc: Properties for the in-memory Outbox.

properties.name: cds.outbox.inMemory.emitDuringChangeSetContext
properties.doc:
Specifies whether the outbox emits the event during the current `ChangeSetContext` or afterwards.
In case the `ChangeSetContext` wraps a DB transaction, it needs to be considered that
emitted messages during the transaction can't be rolled back on cancelled transaction.
Messages being emitted after the transaction might get lost, after transaction has been committed successful.

properties.name: cds.outbox.inMemory.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.outbox.persistent
properties.doc: Properties for the persistent Outbox.

properties.name: cds.outbox.persistent.maxAttempts
properties.doc:
Specifies the maximum number of attempts to emit a message stored in the Outbox.
Messages that have reached the maximum number of attempts are ignored by the Outbox and need to be handled by the application.

properties.name: cds.outbox.persistent.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.

properties.name: cds.outbox.persistent.storeLastError
properties.doc: Controls storing the error message of the last error in the Outbox.

properties.name: cds.outbox.persistent.storeLastError.enabled
properties.doc: Determines, if it is enabled.
